questionText: The National Calendar based on the Saka Era, with Chaitra as its first month and a normal year of 365 days was adopted from ______________ along with the Gregorian calendar for the following official purposes: (i) Gazette of India, (ii) news broadcast by All India Radio, (iii) calendars issued by the Government of India and (iv) Government communications addressed to the public?
Which of the following statements is / are incorrect?
statements: Ali-Ai-Ligang a spring festivity associated with agriculture celebrated by the Mising people of Assam.
Me dam me phi is a socio-traditional festival celebrated by the Tai-Ahom people of Assam.
Kherai is the greatest religious festival of Dimasas.
statementInstructions: Select the answer using the codes given below:

questionText: The 18th edition of the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas will take place in Bhubaneswar from January 8 to 10, 2025. The event aims to strengthen ties with the Indian diaspora and celebrate their contributions to the nation's development. Which of the following statements is / are correct?
statements: Pravasi Bharatiya Divas is celebrated annually on January 9. This date marks Mahatma Gandhi's return to India from South Africa in 1915.
This year's theme is "Diaspora's Contribution to a Viksit Bharat."
statementInstructions: Select the correct answer using the codes given below:

questionText: Which of the following greenhouse gases have the highest atmospheric lifetime in years?

statements: Amount of water vapour decreases from equator to pole wards.
Water vapour absorbs some portion of the heat emitted from the Sun and stores the heat coming out of the Earth.
Water vapour acts like a blanket and does not allow the Earth to get too hot nor too cold.
statementInstructions: How many of the statements given above are correct?

questionText: Why is the Prime Minister in India not directly elected by the people? Choose the most appropriate answer and give reasons for your choice:
options: In a Parliamentary democracy only the leader of the majority party in the Lok Sabha can become the Prime Minister.
Lok Sabha can remove the Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers even before the expiry of their term.
Since the Prime Minister is appointed by the President there is no need for it.
Direct election of the Prime Minister will involve lot of expenditure on election.

questionText: Any such transaction, in which property is transferred in the name of one person and payment is made by another person, is called __________?
The "Chipko Movement" in India is known for:
options: Advocating for the rights of forest-dwelling tribal communities
Promoting the commercialization of forest resources
Encouraging the construction of large-scale dams in forested areas

questionText: Which of the following leaders signed the Tashkent Agreement?
options: Lal Bahadur Shastri and Ayub Khan

questionText: Which one of the following is not basic elements of the citizen charter?
options: Description of services being provided by department or the agency.
Promotion of various methods to get benefit from the services available.
Provision for the inspection of the agency's work.
